SEARCH
Module ci553.happyshop
Package ci553.happyshop.storageAccess

Interface DatabaseRW

All Known Implementing Classes:
DerbyRW
public interface DatabaseRW
The DatabaseRW interface defines the contract for interacting with the product database. It is currently implemented by the DerbyRW class, which provides the actual functionality. Responsibilities: - Searching for products by keyword or product ID. - Performing stock updates and validations during purchases. - Updating, deleting, or inserting products. - Checking whether a product ID is available before insertion. Why use this interface: Introducing this interface allows for better separation of specification and implementation, making the system more adaptable and maintainable. 1. **Ease of Substitution**: If the application switches to a different database system (e.g., from Derby to MySQL or SQLite), a new implementation can be provided without affecting other components. 2. **Improved Testability**: During unit testing, mock implementations can simulate database behavior, enabling effective testing without requiring a live database connection.

  • Method Details

    • searchProduct

      ArrayList<Product> searchProduct(String keyword) throws SQLException
      Searches for products by a keyword, which may match the product ID or appear in the description.
      Parameters:
      keyword - the keyword to search for
      Returns:
      a list of products matching the keyword
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • searchByProductId

      Product searchByProductId(String productId) throws SQLException
      Searches for a product by its unique product ID.
      Parameters:
      productId - the product ID
      Returns:
      the matching product, or null if not found
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • purchaseStocks

      ArrayList<Product> purchaseStocks(ArrayList<Product> proList) throws SQLException
      Attempts to purchase (reduce stocks of) the given list of products. Behavior: - If all requested quantities are available, stocks are reduced and an empty list is returned. - If any product does not have sufficient stock, no stock is updated and a list of all insufficient products is returned.
      Parameters:
      proList - the list of products with requested quantities to purchase
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • updateProduct

      void updateProduct(String id, String des, double price, String imageName, int stock) throws SQLException
      Updates the details of a product identified by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the product ID
      des - the new description
      price - the new price
      imageName - the new image file name
      stock - the updated stock quantity
      Throws:
      SQLException

      Inserts a new product into the database.

      price - the product price

    • isProIdAvailable

      boolean isProIdAvailable(String productId) throws SQLException
      Checks whether the given product ID is available for use (i.e., not already in use).
      Parameters:
      productId - the product ID to check
      Returns:
      true if the ID is available, false if it already exists in the database
      Throws:
      SQLException
